meanings.definition: Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result.
meanings.sent1: Her work on the project was impressive.
meanings.sent2: I have a lot of work to do before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The robot complained about having to do all the work.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work is like a shining light in the office.
meanings.sent5: The work required for the marathon was daunting.

meanings.definition: A task or tasks to be undertaken.
meanings.sent1: Finishing this work will take some time.
meanings.sent2: The teacher assigned us a lot of work for the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The work of cleaning the garage seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The work of organizing the event felt like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The work of painting the house was a colorful adventure.

meanings.definition: A place where one is employed.
meanings.sent1: She goes to work at the hospital every day.
meanings.sent2: His work is demanding but fulfilling.
meanings.sent3: The work at the bakery always smells delicious.
meanings.sent4: The work at the farm is a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The work at the office is always buzzing with activity.

meanings.definition: To be engaged in physical or mental activity in order to achieve a result.
meanings.sent1: I work hard to improve my skills.
meanings.sent2: She will work on the problem until it's solved.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel worked tirelessly to gather nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: The artist worked magic with their paintbrush.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to build a strong bond.

meanings.sent1: The old car still works perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The new machine needs some adjustments to work smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The plan worked like a charm.
meanings.sent4: Her smile worked wonders to brighten the room.
meanings.sent5: The key worked its way into the lock with a satisfying click.
